results.title: A Christmas story
results.creator_credit: Djuma Dawes, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: After the Australian Government’s 2008 introduction of a new ‘income management’ regime for Northern Territory Aboriginal Australians, many families were unable to celebrate Christmas as usual. Djuma Dawes tells how his mother and other supporters, including Rotary Australia, arranged for the delivery of 16,000 Christmas presents across the Territory, believing that ‘everyone deserves to have a Merry Christmas.’
results.creator_credit_for_label: Djuma Dawes, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: After the Australian Government’s 2008 introduction of a new ‘income management’ regime for Northern Territory Aboriginal Australians, many families were unable to celebrate Christmas as usual. Djuma Dawes tells how his mother and other supporters, including Rotary Australia, arranged for the delivery of 16,000 Christmas presents across the Territory, believing that ‘everyone deserves to have a Merry Christmas.’
description_for_label: After the Australian Government’s 2008 introduction of a new ‘income management’ regime for Northern Territory Aboriginal Australians, many families were unable to celebrate Christmas as usual. Djuma Dawes tells how his mother and other supporters, including Rotary Australia, arranged for the delivery of 16,000 Christmas presents across the Territory, believing that ‘everyone deserves to have a Merry Christmas.’

results.title: Behind the scenes
results.creator_credit: Tim Kanoa, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Six Indigenous Youth Leadership Programme scholars were invited to participate in a Digital Storytelling workshop at ACMI in June 2007. Here is a glimpse behind the scenes of the workshop and interviews with the participants on their experience.

results.title: Adventures in the Strait
results.creator_credit: Sorogo Mills, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: The rope that linked the dinghy to the boat had snapped. It was up to me to fix it. Sorogo’s story about an experience that showed him what he was really made of.

results.title: This is a story about the land we live on
results.creator_credit: Alisha Dark, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: This land has cared for our ancestors for generations and now it’s our turn to care for it. We need to take responsibility. This story is about Alisha’s personal connection with the land.
results.title_for_label: This is a story about the land we live on
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alisha Dark, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Circling the globe in comfort
results.creator_credit: Jaaf Nieuwenhuis and Royal Rotterdam Lloyd
results.brief_description: Historical documentary of a round-the-world trip by the 23,000 ton Dutch liner, the “Willem Ruys”, beginning from Sydney and calling into Wellington (NZ), Lima (Peru), Balboa (Panama City), Miami, Bermuda, Southampton, Rotterdam, passing Portugal, Gibraltar and Malta to Port Said and into the Suez Canal. From the Suez Canal the voyage then continues on through the Red Sea to aden, into the Indian Ocean to Colombo, then Singapore, across the Equator past Java and Christmas Island to Cape Leeuwin and finally arriving in Melbourne.
results.description: Historical documentary of a round-the-world trip by the 23,000 ton Dutch liner, the “Willem Ruys”, beginning from Sydney and calling into Wellington (NZ), Lima (Peru), Balboa (Panama City), Miami, Bermuda, Southampton, Rotterdam, passing Portugal, Gibraltar and Malta to Port Said and into the Suez Canal. From the Suez Canal the voyage then continues on through the Red Sea to aden, into the Indian Ocean to Colombo, then Singapore, across the Equator past Java and Christmas Island to Cape Leeuwin and finally arriving in Melbourne.
description_for_label: Historical documentary of a round-the-world trip by the 23,000 ton Dutch liner, the “Willem Ruys”, beginning from Sydney and calling into Wellington (NZ), Lima (Peru), Balboa (Panama City), Miami, Bermuda, Southampton, Rotterdam, passing Portugal, Gibraltar and Malta to Port Said and into the Suez Canal. From the Suez Canal the voyage then continues on through the Red Sea to aden, into the Indian Ocean to Colombo, then Singapore, across the Equator past Java and Christmas Island to Cape Leeuwin and finally arriving in Melbourne.
